snippet: Supporters saw the framework agreement as a breakthrough that would avert war, while critics in Israel saw the opposite.
abstract: Israeli government and its supporters believe that nuclear framework agreement with Iran, if finalized, would pave way to Iranian bomb, not block it.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Reporting was contributed by Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, Steven Erlanger from London, Irit Pazner Garshowitz from Jerusalem, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Supporters saw the framework agreement as a breakthrough that would avert war, while critics in Israel saw the opposite.

headline.main: Disarmament Groups Welcome Iran Framework; Israel Is Mistrustful
headline.print_headline: Disarmament Groups Embrace Framework Deal; Israel Criticizes It

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
